title: Sensex off day's highs, Nifty below 23,350 as FMCG, pharma stocks fall; Adani shares gain - Moneycontrol
summary:
Sensex off day's highs, Nifty below 23,350 as FMCG, pharma stocks fall; Adani shares gain

Date: January 16, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

Benchmark indices Nifty and Sensex continued to trade in the positive, albeit off highs, despite a selloff in FMCG and pharma stocks. Meanwhile, Adani Group stocks rallied after the disbandment of Hindenburg Research.

  • Sensex was up 261.44 points or 0.34 percent at 76,985.52.
  • Nifty was up 85.95 points or 0.37 percent at 23,299.15.
  • Adani stocks rebounded following the end of scrutiny from Hindenburg Research.
  • Positive US inflation data for December boosted investor sentiment globally.
“Markets continued their upward momentum for the third consecutive session.”

This market behavior indicates a cautious tone in defensive sectors like FMCG and pharma, while some recovery in Adani shares points to changing investor sentiments.
newTitle: Sensex Drops as FMCG and Pharma Stocks Decline; Adani Shares Rally

title: JP Morgan bullish on Indian Q-commerce, predicts upside potential up to 50% for Zomato, Swiggy - The Economic Times
summary:
JP Morgan bullish on Indian Q-commerce, predicts upside potential up to 50% for Zomato, Swiggy

Publication Date: Not specified Source: The Economic Times

Global brokerage firm JP Morgan has expressed confidence in the Indian Quick Commerce (Q-Commerce) sector by maintaining 'Overweight' ratings on Zomato and Swiggy, projecting significant share price increases.

  • JP Morgan suggests Swiggy has a potential upside of 50%, while Zomato could see a 39.4% increase.
  • Key players are significantly expanding their dark store networks, with Blinkit exceeding 1,000 stores and Zepto over 700 stores as of Q3 2024.
  • Both companies are strategically focusing on penetrating smaller markets through new store additions.
  • Looking to 2025, all major players are expected to add over 200 new dark stores.
“Zomato's Quick Commerce Profit & Loss (P&L) is well-positioned to absorb further growth without significantly impacting contribution margin and EBITDA.”

This expansion reflects JP Morgan’s confidence in the quick commerce market growth in India, highlighting substantial opportunities beyond major cities.
newTitle: JP Morgan Optimistic About India's Q-Commerce, Predicts Major Upside for Zomato and Swiggy

title: TSMC Q4 profit beats expectations on robust AI demand - Investing.com
Hyundai Creta Electric Review: Long-Awaited EV Is Familiar And Feature-Loaded - NDTV
summary:
Hyundai Creta Electric Review: Long-Awaited EV Is Familiar And Feature-Loaded

Publication Date: Not specified Source: NDTV

The new Hyundai Creta Electric combines familiarity with modern electric features, promising impressive range and performance.

  • Powered by a 51.4 kWh battery, the Creta EV offers a range of 473 km on a single charge.
  • Performance is impressive, achieving 0-100 km/h in just 7.9 seconds.
  • Retains the driving dynamics of the internal combustion engine version, with improved ride comfort.
  • Features such as lane keep assist, blind spot monitoring, and various driving modes enhance the driving experience.
  • Charging capabilities include 11 kW AC wallbox charging and 50 kW DC fast charging.
  • Interior is feature-rich, with dual 10.25-inch screens and premium materials.
  • Offers vehicle-to-load functionality for powering external devices.
“Creta Electric is typically a Hyundai: Feature-loaded, familiar and family-oriented.”

In conclusion, while the Creta Electric offers many comforts and features, it may lack the 'wow' factor, with pricing being a crucial factor for potential buyers.
newTitle: Hyundai Creta Electric Review: Long-Awaited EV Is Familiar And Feature-Loaded

title: SENSEX jumps over 500 pts in early trade, NIFTY50 above 23,350; LTTS jumps 10%, CEAT shares fall 6% post Q3 numbers - Upstox
After a 10% lower circuit on Wednesday, Kalyan Jewellers shares extend losses - CNBCTV18
summary:
Kalyan Jewellers Shares Continue to Fall Amid Declining Trend

Date: January 15, 2025 2:36 PM IST

Source: CNBC-TV18

Kalyan Jewellers shares have seen a significant decline, falling 6% on Thursday after a previously 10% drop. This marks a continuing trend, with the stock down in nine of the last ten trading sessions.

  • Shares fell 8% on Wednesday due to hitting a 10% lower circuit.
  • Only one gain for the stock since January 3.
  • The stock is currently banned from new positions in the Futures & Options market.
  • Q3 revenue rose 39% overall, with a 41% increase in India led by strong demand.
  • Ramesh Kalyanaraman stated that fluctuations should be viewed in a long-term context.
  • The stock is considered oversold with an RSI of 24.
  • Current trading at ₹536, down 3.5% on Thursday.
Ramesh Kalyanaraman: "Over the past two and a half years, Kalyan Jewellers has delivered consistent performance. Short-term volatility may have occurred due to profit-booking, corrections, or broader macroeconomic factors."

The decline in Kalyan Jewellers shares reflects recent market trends impacting investor sentiment, though analysts remain generally positive about its long-term prospects.
newTitle: Kalyan Jewellers Shares Continue to Fall Amid Declining Trend

title: Air India passenger says airline downgraded him to economy class, gave his seat to pilot: ‘Horrible experience’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
Air India passenger says airline downgraded him to economy class, gave his seat to pilot: ‘Horrible experience’

Date: Jan 16, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

An Air India customer has accused the airline of downgrading him to economy class and giving his seat to a crew member instead, resulting in a troubling experience for him and his young son.

  • The passenger, Nilesh Bansal, waited for over 90 minutes for their flight despite assurances from the crew that seats were available.
  • Ultimately, their business class seats were allocated to an Air India pilot, forcing them into economy class.
  • Bansal claimed the airline also left his son’s stroller behind in Delhi.
  • The incident sparked discussion on social media about passenger rights versus crew priorities.
“Today Air India flight AI-2055 downgraded me to economy class, ... Shameful,” - Nilesh Bansal

This incident has fueled conversations about customer service standards in airlines and the treatment of passengers compared to crew members.
newTitle: Passenger Criticizes Air India for Downgrading From Business to Economy Class

title: Adani Group shares rise as Hindenburg founder disbands short-seller - The Hindu
summary:
Adani Group shares rise as Hindenburg founder disbands short-seller

Date: January 16, 2025

Source: The Hindu

Adani Group company shares rose sharply on Thursday morning after Hindenburg Research founder Nate Anderson announced his decision to disband the entity.

  • The shares of Adani Enterprises Limited increased by 4.16% to ₹2485.
  • Adani Ports rose by 3.61% to ₹1,172, while Adani Power increased by 4.79% to ₹576.
  • Other group entities also showed positive trading.
  • In 2022, Hindenburg accused Adani Group of corporate governance violations, which Adani rejected.
“And as of the last Ponzi cases we just completed and are sharing with regulators, that day is today,” said Nate Anderson.

The market responded positively to the disbanding of Hindenburg Research, suggesting a rebound for the Adani Group after previous challenges.
newTitle: Adani Group shares rise as Hindenburg founder disbands short-seller

title: HDFC Life stock jumps 10% on positive Q3 show, brokerages maintain bullishness - Moneycontrol
summary:
HDFC Life stock jumps 10% on positive Q3 show, brokerages maintain bullishness

Date: January 16, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

HDFC Life Insurance Company Ltd. saw its shares jump by 10% following a robust performance in its latest quarterly results. Brokerages maintained a bullish outlook on the insurer.

  • HDFC Life reported a 14% increase in net profit for Q3 FY25, reaching Rs 415 crore.
  • Net premium income grew by 10% year-on-year, amounting to Rs 16,771 crore.
  • The Annualised Premium Equivalent (APE) increased by 15.5% to Rs 3,686 crore.
  • The Value of New Business (VNB) grew 17.8% to Rs 1,009 crore, with an improved margin of 27.4%.
“HDFC Life exceeded market expectations on key metrics.”

The positive results have solidified brokerages' confidence in HDFC Life, predicting future growth due to its focus on new customer acquisition and expanding distribution channels.
newTitle: HDFC Life Shares Surge 10% Following Strong Q3 Performance

title: 2025 Honda CBR650R: Top 5 highlights - BikeWale
summary:
2025 Honda CBR650R: Top 5 Highlights

Date & Source: October 2023, BikeWale

The 2025 iteration of the CBR650R has been launched by Honda after a brief hiatus, with deliveries set to begin in February 2025. Here are the key highlights of this motorcycle.

  • Sportier design: The new CBR650R features an updated design with sportier and more aggressive aesthetics.
  • Tweaked suspension: Revised front forks enhance stability and comfort while maintaining existing braking hardware.
  • Additional features: New five-inch colour TFT screen with Bluetooth connectivity and additional safety features.
  • Same inline-four engine: The motorcycle retains the revered 649cc engine delivering smooth power.
  • Price: The new CBR650R is priced at Rs. 9.99 lakh, ex-showroom, Delhi.
“Bookings of the bike are open at all BigWing dealerships across India.”

The 2025 Honda CBR650R presents a blend of updated design and advanced features, promising to enhance the riding experience while retaining its powerful engine.
newTitle: 2025 Honda CBR650R: Top 5 Highlights

title: Indian rupee opens marginally down at 86.42 against dollar - Moneycontrol
summary:
Indian Rupee Opens Marginally Down at 86.42 Against Dollar

Date: January 16, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

The Indian rupee opened marginally down on January 16 at 86.42 against the US dollar after ending the previous session at 86.3625. The rupee made some recovery, trading at 86.40.

  • The rupee gained on January 15 due to improved trade balances.
  • India's trade deficit narrowed to $21.94 billion, supported by a $6 billion increase in exports and a $10 billion decline in imports.
  • This is the lowest merchandise trade deficit since September, when it was $20.79 billion.
"The improvement was underpinned by a robust $6 billion growth in exports and $10 billion decline in imports."

The Indian rupee's fluctuations demonstrate the influence of trade balances and central bank intervention. Continued improvements in trade may stabilize the currency going forward.
newTitle: Indian Rupee Marginally Declines to 86.42 Against the Dollar

title: US government moving towards permanent visa renewal process within the country. Here's a rundown - Hindustan Times
summary:
US Government Moves Towards Permanent Visa Renewal Process

Date: Jan 16, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

The US government is set to implement a permanent H1B visa renewal program within the country by 2025, following the success of a pilot program conducted in early 2024.

  • The new program will allow for visa renewals, including H1B visas, to be completed domestically.
  • The pilot program ran from January 29, 2024, to April 1, 2024, and was confirmed successful by the US Embassy in India.
  • Specific H1B applicants were eligible during the pilot phase, which streamlined the renewal process.
  • Important points regarding the process include potential visa denials, legal status determination based on I-94, and additional documentation requirements.
“The Department of State completed a successful pilot program to renew H-1B visas in the United States this year. This allowed many specialty occupation workers from India to renew their visas without leaving the United States.”

The establishment of this program is aimed at facilitating easier visa renewal for applicants, reflecting the government's ongoing efforts to improve the immigration process.
newTitle: US Government Moves Towards Permanent Visa Renewal Process

title: Ambani Led Jio Platforms Teams Up with Polygon to Bring Web3 Capabilities to Over 450M Users - CoinDesk
summary:
Indian Telecom Giant Jio Joins Hands With Polygon to Bring Web3 to Over 450M Users

Updated: Jan 15, 2025, 4:44 a.m. UTC | Published: Jan 16, 2025, 3:30 a.m. UTC

Jio Platforms is enhancing the digital experience for its over 450 million users through a partnership with Polygon Labs to launch Web3 services in India.

  • Jio Platforms is a subsidiary of Reliance Industries, led by Mukesh Ambani.
  • The collaboration will integrate Polygon's blockchain technology in Jio's existing apps.
  • Kiran Thomas, CEO of JPL, describes the partnership as a major milestone for digital excellence.
  • Polygon's co-founder, Sandeep Nailwal, emphasizes the significance for Web3 adoption in India.
  • Web3 represents the next generation of the internet, focusing on decentralized technologies and user empowerment.
Kiran Thomas: "Partnering with Polygon Labs is a major milestone for Jio as we strive for digital excellence. We are excited to explore the limitless opportunities of Web3 and deliver exceptional digital experiences to our users."
Sandeep Nailwal: "This is a significant step forward for Web3 adoption in India. We look forward to collaborating with Jio as they introduce Web3 to millions of customers."
newTitle: Jio Platforms Partners with Polygon to Advance Web3 Access for 450 Million Users

title: Zomato added to CLSA’s 'High Conviction' list with Rs 400 target price, sees 64% upside potential - Moneycontrol

8th Central Pay Commission, 18 months DA/DR Arrear, Festival Advance, Additional Pension, Fixed Medical Advance, Commuted Pension, IT Rebate etc: NC JCM demands to include in Union Budget - Staff News
summary:
NC JCM Demands Key Changes for Central Government Salary and Pension in Union Budget 2025

Date: January 10, 2025 | Source: StaffNews

The National Council (Staff Side) Joint Consultative Machinery (JCM) has submitted significant demands to the Hon’ble Minister for Finance urging the inclusion of essential provisions for Central Government employees in the upcoming Union Budget 2025-2026.

  • Establishment of the 8th Central Pay Commission for timely wage and pension revision.
  • Release of 18 months of Dearness Allowance arrears frozen during COVID-19.
  • Restoration of Festival Advance for employees, seeking Rs.30,000/- yearly.
  • Implementation of Parliamentary Standing Committee recommendations for CGHS facilities.
  • Action on Pensioners grievances, including enhanced allowances.
  • Restoration of Commuted Pension after 12 years instead of 15.
  • Strengthening the Joint Consultative Machinery for effective decision-making.
  • Income Tax rebate for salaried individuals earning up to Rs. 10 lakh annually.
"We sincerely hope that your good self will consider favorably the above-mentioned issues/demands of the Central Government employees and proposals, and include them in the Union Budget 2025-26." - Shiva Gopal Mishra, Secretary (Staff Side)

The JCM emphasizes the need for these measures to address the escalating cost of living and the financial strain faced by employees and pensioners.
newTitle: NC JCM Demands Key Changes for Central Government Salary and Pension in Union Budget 2025

title: RVNL shares in focus after securing Rs 3,622 crore contract from BSNL for BharatNet Middle Mile Network De - The Economic Times
Reliance Industries Q3: Check earnings preview and options strategy ahead of Q3 results - Upstox
summary:
Earnings Preview of Reliance Industries Q3 Results

Date: January 16, 2025

Source: Upstox

Reliance Industries is expected to announce its Q3 results with predictions of moderate growth in net profit and consolidated revenue.

  • Projected Q3 net profit growth of 5-8% sequentially, reaching ₹17,300-17,900 crore.
  • Consolidated revenue projected to rise by 0.5-1% quarter-on-quarter to ₹2.33-2.37 lakh crore.
  • Revenue may grow by 3-5% year-on-year.
  • EBITDA is expected to be between ₹40,200-40,500 crore, indicating a rise of 5-7%.
  • Key segments include refining, telecom, and retail, with focus on management's outlook.
"Investors will closely watch Reliance’s Q3 results to assess the performance of its key segments."

In conclusion, the projected earnings suggest a stable performance but with a cautious outlook due to recent market trends.
newTitle: Earnings Preview of Reliance Industries Q3 Results

title: Stocks to watch, January 16: Mastek, L&T Tech, Infosys, RVNL, RIL, Axis Bank, GAIL, LTIMindree, and more - Upstox
summary:
Stocks to Watch on January 16: Key Companies and Earnings Updates

Publication Date: January 16, 2023
Source: Financial News

The domestic equity market is gearing up for a positive start, with key stocks like Reliance Industries, Axis Bank, and Infosys set to announce their Q3 results today.

  • Reliance Industries (RIL): Expected to report a mixed Q3 performance influenced by telecom and refining sectors.
  • Axis Bank: Anticipated to release its Q3 earnings today.
  • Infosys: Expected to show flat revenue growth with slight profit increases.
  • CEAT: Reported a significant decline in net profit due to high raw material costs.
  • RVNL: Secured a ₹3,622.14 crore contract from BSNL for BharatNet development and maintenance.
  • HDFC Life: Reported a 14% rise in net profit with a decline in total income.
  • GAIL: Settled a legal dispute with Gazprom's subsidiary for $285 million.
“While the rising raw material costs have impacted our margins, we progressively passed on part of the increase through price increases in select categories.” - Arnab Banerjee, MD & CEO, CEAT Ltd

Market participants are closely monitoring these updates for insights on financial health and future guidance, particularly in the context of ongoing economic challenges.
newTitle: Stocks to Watch on January 16: Key Companies and Earnings Updates

title: Stocks rise with US rate cuts back in view; yen at one-month high - Reuters
Carmakers in India plan EV onslaught in 2025 despite slowing global demand - The Economic Times
Asia-Pacific markets track Wall Street gains; South Korea unexpectedly keeps rates unchanged - CNBC

ITC Hotels Demerger: Sanjiv Puri's 1st comment on share listing, valuation and business expansion - ET Now
summary:
ITC Hotels Demerger: Sanjiv Puri's 1st comment on share listing, valuation and business expansion

Updated Jan 16, 2025 - Source: ET NOW

ITC Chairman Sanjiv Puri has made his first comments regarding the demerger of ITC Hotels from the parent company, discussing the forthcoming listing of shares and expansion plans.

  • ITC Hotels shares will list on NSE and BSE within the next few weeks, with a target before mid-February 2025.
  • Sanjiv Puri emphasized that the market will determine the company's valuation post-demerger.
  • 125.11 crore equity shares have been allotted to eligible ITC shareholders as per the demerger scheme.
  • ITC Hotels plans to expand internationally, initially focusing on neighboring countries and West Asia.
“The role of management is to run the business well, make the businesses contemporary and future-ready, create value, and let the market determine the valuation.” - Sanjiv Puri

Sanjiv Puri highlighted that ITC currently operates 140 properties with plans for international growth while focusing initially on the proximate markets.
newTitle: ITC Hotels Demerger: Sanjiv Puri Discusses Share Listing and Business Expansion

title: ITC chairman on 90-hour work week: We would rather like employees to ... - The Times of India
summary:
ITC Chairman on 90-hour work week: We would rather like employees to ...

Publication Date: Not specified. Source: Not specified.

The ITC chairman expressed a preference for a balanced work environment rather than pushing employees into extreme 90-hour work weeks. Emphasizing the need for productivity without compromising employee well-being is becoming increasingly relevant in modern work culture.

  • The chairman advocates for sensible working hours instead of excessively long weeks.
  • Focus on employee well-being is highlighted as essential for productivity.
We believe in creating an environment that fosters a healthy work-life balance.

This perspective underlines the growing recognition among industry leaders of the importance of maintaining a healthy work environment for sustainable productivity.
newTitle: ITC Chairman Advocates for Reasonable Work Hours Over 90-Hour Weeks

title: Nifty 50, Sensex today: What to expect from Indian stock market in trade on Jan 16 after Hindenburg shut down | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Nifty 50 and Sensex Outlook for January 16 After Market Rally

Publication Date: January 16, 2023 | Source: Live Mint

The Indian stock market is expected to open higher on January 16, following trends in global markets and a positive uptick in the Gift Nifty index.

  • Sensex closed up by 224.45 points, reaching 76,724.08.
  • Nifty 50 gained 37.15 points, closing at 23,213.20.
  • Market sentiment remains positive above the 23,000 threshold.
  • Prediction suggests potential resistance at 23,350 and support at 23,050.
  • Technical analysts note weakness in the index with future volatility expected.
“This market action signals choppy movement in the market with positive bias.” - Nagaraj Shetti, Senior Technical Research Analyst

The outlook for the Indian stock market indicates a cautious optimism despite signs of weakness in the index. Watch for key levels of support and resistance in the upcoming trading sessions.
newTitle: Nifty 50 and Sensex Outlook for January 16 After Market Rally

title: First Tick: Here are the top global cues for today’s trade - Moneycontrol
Tesla’s Asian rivals pull ahead in India’s nascent EV market - The Economic Times
summary:
Tesla’s Asian Rivals Pull Ahead in India’s Nascent EV Market

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Economic Times

This week at the Bharat Mobility Global Expo in New Delhi, various carmakers, including Maruti Suzuki, BYD, and VinFast, are set to debut their electric vehicles. Meanwhile, Tesla's continued absence allows Asian manufacturers to dominate in India's evolving EV market.

  • Maruti Suzuki, a late entry, is launching the e-Vitara electric SUV developed with Toyota.
  • BYD and VinFast are showcasing new electric models, intensifying competition.
  • Tesla has not yet entered the Indian market, largely due to high import taxes.
  • The Indian government has revised import duties to encourage local manufacturing.
“When you have some of the global manufacturers coming in, it creates a lot of buzz.” - Amit Bhatt, International Council for Clean Transportation

The expansion of the EV market in India represents a significant opportunity for both manufacturers and the country's environmental goals.
newTitle: Tesla’s Asian Rivals Pull Ahead in India’s Nascent EV Market

title: Hindenburg Research, whose reports wiped billions off Gautam Adani's wealth, shuts down - The Economic Times
US stock futures steady after Wall St rallies on soft CPI, strong bank earnings - Investing.com
summary:
US Stock Futures Steady After Wall St Rallies on Soft CPI and Strong Bank Earnings

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Investing.com

U.S. stock index futures rose slightly as investors reacted to softer consumer inflation data and strong bank earnings on Wall Street.

  • U.S. stock futures experienced a slight increase following positive market movements.
  • Investors are optimistic due to a ceasefire deal between Israel and Hamas, reducing geopolitical tensions.
  • The market remains cautious ahead of the incoming President-elect Donald Trump's economic strategies.
  • Recent economic data showed a minor slowdown in inflation, possibly leading to interest rate cuts by the Federal Reserve.
  • Strong earnings reports from companies like JPMorgan, Wells Fargo, Goldman Sachs, and Citigroup boosted market confidence.
  • Positive performance of stocks, including a notable rise in U.S. shares of Brazilian airline Azul.
“Markets are still pricing in about two rate cuts this year, half of the four initially projected for the year.”

The stock market appears to show resilience amid mixed economic signals, with investors remaining watchful of political developments and upcoming economic data.
newTitle: US Stock Futures Steady After Wall St Rallies on Soft CPI and Strong Bank Earnings

title: Hindenburg Research, which published report on Adani Group, to be disbanded: Founder - Hindustan Times
summary:
Hindenburg Research Founder Announces Shutdown Amid Intense Work Pressure

Date: January 16, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Nathan Anderson, founder of Hindenburg Research, has announced the disbandment of his firm, citing the intense nature of the work as the primary reason. The firm has been instrumental in revealing significant corporate malpractices, impacting billionaire portfolios especially in connection with the Adani Group.

  • Anderson will wind up the firm after completing its last projects.
  • He emphasized the work's personal toll, stating it came at the expense of personal relationships.
  • Hindenburg's reports have prompted significant market losses for companies involved, including a reported $99 billion reduction in wealth for multiple financiers.
  • There will be a focus on creating educational materials regarding Hindenburg’s investigative methods.
“The intensity and focus has come at the cost of missing a lot of the rest of the world and the people I care about.” - Nathan Anderson

With Hindenburg Research coming to a close, Anderson plans to ensure his team's future placements while leaving a significant impact on corporate governance watchdog practices.
newTitle: Hindenburg Research Founder Announces Shutdown Amid Intense Work Pressure
